intro: Downingia bacigalupii, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Downingia bacigalupii is known for its ornamental value and is often found in rocky habitats. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
